IRM 21.1.1.3.1 - Revised IF/THEN chart to remove procedures for Online Payment Agreement; updated procedures to refer the assistor to IRM 21.5.2.4.8, Suppressing Balance Due Notices when taxpayer request a STAUP or hold on the account; revised chart to provide guidance when taxpayer requests balance due or payoff amount immediately when account is in Status 22/26 or requests payoff amount to pay in the future regardless of the account status; added procedures when taxpayer request a change or update to Installment Agreement; corrected Automated Collection System Support link; added NOTE to advise caller of other factors impacting account balance; advising caller of beneﬁts of self-help method; removed IF/THEN chart referring to Online Payment Arrangements (OPA). IPU 21U1159 issued 10-08-2021.

IRM 21.1.1.3.1 - Revised IF/THEN chart when taxpayer requests a hold on account to align with other impacted IRMs; provides how to obtain mailing address and additional information for cases in Status 26 when requesting penalty abatements. IPU 21U1218 issued 11-01-2021.

IRM 21.1.1.3.1 - Revised IF/THEN chart to remove check or money order and revised to electronic payments as IRM references submitting payments electronically. Also updated various IRM references. IPU 21U1355 issued 12-20-2021.
IRM 21.1.1.3.1(2) - Revised IF/THEN chart to provide more detailed instructions when the caller requests information about where and how to send payments for clarity. IPU 22U0170 issued
IRM 21.1.1.3.1(2) - Added Voice BOT option for callers requesting where/how to send payments in IF/THEN chart.

IRM 21.1.1.3.1(4) - Added transfer numbers for the transfer to the Voice BOT automated system; provides suggested verbiage when transferring the call; advises to transfer to ACS using the Telephone Transfer Guide when the caller does not want to transfer to the Voice BOT. IPU 22U0034 issued 01-04-2022.
IRM 21.1.1.3.1(7) - Updated the Product Lines/Reference chart to align with the Voice BOT automated system. IPU 22U0034 issued 01-04-2022.

IRM 21.1.1.3.3.2(3) - Updated to reﬂect the removal of IRM references 21.6.4.4.21, IRC Transition Tax on Untaxed Foreign Earnings, IMF and 21.7.4.4.25, Section 965 Transition Tax, BMF. IRMs have been obsoleted and procedures moved to IRM 21.5.13, IRC 965 Transition Tax Procedures - Accounts Management.
IRM 21.1.1.4 - Rewrote portions to conform with the procedures outlined in the Technical Communication Documents (TCD). IPU 22U0711 issued 06-10-2022.
IRM 21.1.1.4(2) - Added ﬁrst name and last initial as an option for identiﬁcation per the Restructuring Reform Act of 98 (RRA 98). IPU 22U0170 issued 01-28-2022.
IRM 21.1.1.4(4)(a) - Added procedural topic to subsection to align with procedural topics listed in the Telephone Transfer Guide.
IRM 21.1.1.4(4)(b) - Added exception for unauthorized callers to obtain certain types of information to assist a taxpayer with non-speciﬁc information to resolve tax related issues.
IRM 21.1.1.4(7) - Added instruction when unauthorized taxpayers calls to discuss taxpayer account. Information was added to this section for continuity. IPU 22U0653 issued 05-26-2022.

IRM 21.1.1.4(9)(d) - Added NOTE for guidance when taxpayers ask to place the representative on hold. Update was made due to excessive hold times. IPU 21U1355 issued 12-20-2021. Guidance is now located in IRM 21.1.1.4(8)(e).
IRM 21.1.1.4(9)(e) - Added guidance when the taxpayer is not prepared to send a document by fax. IPU 21U1159 issued 10-08-2021. Guidance is now located in IRM 21.1.1.4(9)(a).

IRM 21.1.1.4(9)(h) - Added procedures for businesses and practitioners to be allowed to request up to 30 transcripts. The change was made to allow businesses/practitioners to request multiple forms, tax periods and years. IPU 21U1238 issued 11-09-2021. Guidance is now located in IRM

IRM 21.1.1.4(9)(h) - Revised Practitioner Priority Service line procedures to conform with IRM 21.3.10.4.4, Transcript Request and IRM 21.2.3.5.7, Transcript Restrictions and Special Handling. IPU 22U0653 issued 05-26-2022.
IRM 21.1.1.4(9)(h)(i) - Separated procedures for clarity. IPU 22U0380 issued 03-14-2022. Guidance is now located in IRM 21.1.1.4(11)(a).
IRM 21.1.1.4(11)(a) - Revised due to error in previous IPU submission. Procedures were originally issued in IPU 22U0653. IPU 22U0801 issued 07-11-2022.

IRM 21.1.1.4(16) - Provided instructions when writing notes in Account Management Services (AMS) or case notes. Notes should be clear and able to understand for the next reader. IPU 22U0380 issued 03-14-2022. Guidance is now located in IRM 1.1.1.4(19).
- Moved statement for continuity and better ﬂow of work
IRM 21.1.1.5(10) - Provided instructions when taxpayer calls with their own interpreter. This procedure does not require transfer for translation unless requested. IPU 22U0380 issued
IRM 21.1.1.6.1(4)(b) - Added instructions for languages other than English and Spanish to align with Over-the-Phone Interpreter Services. IPU 22U0653 issued 05-26-2022.

IRM 21.1.1.9 - Added W&I Accounts Management and Automated Collection Services (ACS) Telephone Customer Satisfaction Survey (CSS) to IRM. Instructions were originally located in IRM 21.10.4, Quality Assurance - Customer Satisfaction Surveys, now obsoleted.

Exhibit 21.1.1-2 - Added IRM reference providing instructions for taxpayers ordering forms and publications and do not have internet access. Procedures were added to comply with Taxpayer Bill of Rights (TBOR) - Right To Be Informed.
Editorial updates have been made throughout this IRM.
EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS

IRM 21.1.1, Accounts Management and Compliance Services Overview, dated 9-9-2021 (effective 10-01- 2021) is superseded. The following IRM procedural updates (IPUs) have been incorporated into this IRM: IPU 21U1159 dated 10-08-2021; IPU 21U1218 dated 11-01-2021; IPU 21U1238 dated 11-09-2021; IPU 21U1355 dated 12-20-22021; IPU 22U0031 dated 01-03-2022; IPU 22U0034 dated 01-04-2022; IPU 22U0170 dated 01- 28-2022; IPU 22U0380 dated 03-14-2022; IPU 22U0653 dated 05-26-2022; IPU 22U0711 dated 06-10-2022 and IPU 22U0801 dated 07-11-2022.
AUDIENCE
All IRS employees in any Business Operating Divisions (BODs) who are in contact with taxpayers by telephone, correspondence, or in person
Accounts Management and Compliance Services Overview
and Compliance Services (
) This IRM provides procedures to help customer service representatives telephone inquiries accurately and quickly. (

) Purpose: The Wage and Investment (W&I) and Small Business/Self (SB/SE) Business Operating Divisions (BODs) handle taxpayer contacts a. Providing general tax related information, b. Providing information on the status of taxpayer and c. Adjusting taxpayer accounts, when proper. (
) Audience: The primary users of this IRM are IRS employees in areas who in contact with taxpayers by telephone, correspondence or in person. (
) Policy Owner: Director of Accounts Management (
) Program Owner: Wage and Investment, Customer Account Services, Accounts Management, Policy and Procedures. (

) Primary Stakeholders: The responsibilities outlined in this IRM are into three subordinate units: • Customer Assistance, Relationships, and Education (CARE) • Customer Account Services (CAS) • Compliance To ensure taxpayer inquiries and accounts are addressed correctly, Assistance Centers (TAC), Accounts Management, and Compliance use the guidelines provided in IRM
, Customer Account Services. (

) Program Goals: Program goals for this type of work are to strive to keep integrity, quality and excellence in the service provided to our telephone face-to-face customers. This is done by achieving a high customer service accuracy rate within each Specialized Product Review Group (SPRG). To continue this, the work performed is continuously monitored and reviewed quality. (

) This IRM is the official source for customer service representatives in mance of daily duties. Interim guidance procedures may be used to updates to the current procedures outlined in this IRM. Employees to taxpayer inquiries and phone calls, the processing of claims and other internal adjustment requests use this IRM as a primary source. (
) Per Policy Statement

: We will actively help taxpayers who try to follow law, and work to continually improve the quality of our systems and service meet the needs of our customers. All taxpayers, whether delinquent or fully compliant, are entitled to prompt and professional service whenever they with Service employees. The public as a whole is our customer, not just quent taxpayers. Our customers expect us to promote voluntary ensuring that all promptly pay their fair share.
Management and Compliance Services 21.1.1
Per Policy Statement

: We will actively help taxpayers who try to follow the law, and work to continually improve the quality of our systems and service to meet the needs of our customers. All taxpayers, whether delinquent or fully compliant, are entitled to prompt and professional service whenever they deal with Service employees. The public as a whole is our customer, not just delin- quent taxpayers. Our customers expect us to promote voluntary compliance by ensuring that all promptly pay their fair share.
Accounts Management and Services Operations (
) The Director of Accounts Management has oversight responsibility for the structions to employees contained in the IRM content. (

) Accounts Management employees handle taxpayer contacts by tax law/account inquiries and adjusting tax accounts. In addition, it is also sponsible for providing taxpayers with information on the status of their refunds, and for resolving the majority of issues and questions to settle accounts. (

) Compliance Services employees handle taxpayer contacts by providing support services to the Compliance organization, including Automated tion System (ACS), Automated Underreporter (AUR), Installment and multiple other programs. (
) For more information on Compliance support services, see IRM
, Determination and IRM
, Liability Collection. (

) The Office of Taxpayer Correspondence (OTC), in Media and Publication is Enterprise point of contact when a signiﬁcant volume of erroneous dence is issued to taxpayers or when there is a risk of issuing considerable volumes of erroneous correspondence. It is the responsibility of all IRS employees to report erroneous correspondence as soon as possible to the OTC. For erroneous correspondence procedures, see IRM
, Erroneous Correspondence Procedures - Report Erroneous Process. (

) Field Assistance (FA) employees handle taxpayer contacts by providing personal help to answer tax law questions and resolve account issues. tance includes multilingual interpreter services, proof of receipt of tax and various other services. (
) For more information on TAC responsibilities, see IRM
, Standard Services in a Taxpayer Assistance Center (TAC), and procedures this IRM. (
) Program Effectiveness: Program effectiveness is determined by employees successfully using the guidelines provided in this IRM. (
) Program Controls: Quality data and guidelines for measurement are refer- enced in IRM
, Embedded Quality (EQ) for Accounts Management, Campus Compliance, Tax Exempt/Government Entities, Return Integrity Compliance Services (RICS) and Electronic Products and Services (

) All functional areas of the IRS are committed to achieving excellence in the service provided to all taxpayers. Customer Service Representatives (CSRs) are trained to communicate with taxpayers and to be knowledgeable of tax and related IRS operational procedures. CSRs must help taxpayers, ners and other third parties, in a manner that warrants the highest degree of public conﬁdence. (

Accounts Management and Services Operations (

) To ensure quality service for our customers, all work performed by CSRs is subject to review. Some of this work is reviewed by the Centralized Quality Review System (CQRS) and some of the work is reviewed by the Program Analysis System (PAS). The national review is designed to review all telephone contacts (account and tax law calls), email, and closed cases paper and telephone initiated). (
) The results of these reviews are input to the National Quality Review (NQRS). NQRS is available to all authorized users. Refer to IRM

, Embedded Quality (EQ) Program for Accounts Management, Campus ance Services, Field Assistance Tax Exempt/Government Entities, Return Integrity and Correspondence Services (RICS), and Electronic Products Services and Services Support, for more information. (

) A CSR (referred to throughout this section) includes, but is not limited to, following named positions: • Contact Representative (CSR) • Individual Taxpayer Advisory Specialist (ITAS) • Office Collection Representative (OCR) • Senior Taxpayer Advisory Specialist (STAS) • Tax Account Representative (TAR) • Tax Examiner (TE) • Tax Law Specialist (TLS) • Tax Specialist (TS) • Tax Technician (TT) • Taxpayer Service Representative (TSR) Note: All employees assigned to Accounts Management, Field Assistance and Compliance Services are considered CSRs. (

) The duties of a CSR are varied. Many hours are spent on the telephone, working paper cases, or helping taxpayers at a TAC counter. Paper cases include both incoming taxpayer correspondence and internally generated cases. (

) The duties of a CSR may include, but are not limited to: • Adjusting tax return accounts • Answering tax law questions • Assisting taxpayers directly or by transferring to the correct using the Telephone Transfer Guide • Preparing substitute returns • Proposing more assessments • Securing delinquent returns • Resolving delinquent accounts • Responding to correspondence • Providing functional support (i.e., other duties as assigned) • Making appointments for Taxpayer Assistance Centers (TACs) • Referring taxpayers to Low Income Tax Clinics (LITCs) (

) The OPI Interpreter is there to help you in communication with the LEP taxpayer regardless of the individual’s preferred language by removing the language barrier between you the caller. • Interpreters are trained to speak in the “ﬁrst person.” Conduct the versation as if you are communicating with an English-speaking taxpayer, in the ﬁrst person. Example: Address the interpreter: “I need you to provide me your forms.” Do NOT address the interpreter: “I need you to the taxpayer to provide their tax forms.” • Speak in short sentences and ask the non-English speaker to do the same. Accounts Management and Compliance Services Overview 21.1.1

The information in this exhibit is for all assistors not receiving calls in the Default Screener application, who have determined that the caller’s question is about an OOS Tax law topic as stated in IRM 21.1.1.3 (6), Customer Service Duties. The caller should be referred to the web site for information as OOS tax law questions should not be answered or implied. Information provided to the caller should be limited to the resources available and basic directions for locating the information.

Initial response to the inquiry (or similar statement): “Thank you for calling us today about (paraphrase tax- payer’s question). I’m sorry, but we do not provide live help on this topic. However, I can provide you resources available to help you.”
Advise the taxpayer that the following resources are available (other proper resources may be provided):
www.irs.gov - Click on Help at the top of the page and select the proper option. • Publications can be accessed through the Forms and Instructions tab. Some examples • Pub
, Your Federal Income Tax for Individuals • Pub
, Starting a Business and Keeping Records • Pub
, (Circular E), Employer’s Tax Guide • Pub
, Excise Tax • Pub
, Survivors, Executors and Administrators • Circular
for Tax Professionals • Access the Interactive Tax Assistant by entering “ITA” in the search box

If the caller seems resistant to using the available resources, the assistor may remind the caller that IRS.gov has easy to use tools to help answer tax questions such as the Interactive Tax Assistant designed to help ﬁnd answers to tax questions quickly and easily. They can also enter their topic or question in the search box on the website.
For taxpayers who do not have internet access and would prefer to order forms and publications by phone, see IRM 21.3.6.4.1, Ordering Forms and Publications.
Close the call.
Additional information for the assistors:

Where do I look on the internet? When you ﬁrst enter the website at www.irs.gov, a search box is available at the top right hand side. Enter your topic in the search box and click on the magnifying glass. Several options the main body of text to help narrow your search are provided. On the home page, there are several tabs available to help you in your research (Make a Payment, Get Your Refund Status, Get Answers to Your Tax Questions, etc.).
